indications.text: isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets , usp indicated prevention angina pectoris due coronary artery disease . onset action oral isosorbide mononitrate sufficiently rapid product useful aborting acute anginal episode .

contraindications.text: recommended starting dose isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets 30 mg ( given single 30 mg tablet 1/2 60 mg tablet ) 60 mg ( given single tablet ) daily . several days , may increased 120 mg ( given single 120 mg tablet two 60 mg tablets ) daily . rarely , 240 mg may required . daily dose isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets taken morning arising . isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets chewed crushed swallowed together half-glassful fluid .

name: ISOSORBIDE MONONITRATE
indications_original: Isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets, USP are indicated for the prevention of angina pectoris due to coronary artery disease. The onset of action of oral isosorbide mononitrate is not sufficiently rapid for this product to be useful in aborting an acute anginal episode.
contraindications_original: The recommended starting dose of isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets is 30 mg (given as a single 30 mg tablet or as 1/2 of a 60 mg tablet) or 60 mg (given as a single tablet) once daily. After several days, the dosage may be increased to 120 mg (given as a single 120 mg tablet or as two 60 mg tablets) once daily. Rarely, 240 mg may be required. The daily dose of isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets should be taken in the morning on arising. Isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets should not be chewed or crushed and should be swallowed together with a half-glassful of fluid.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets, USP 30 mg are white to off-white, oval shaped, film coated tablets having breakline on one side and debossed ‘3-0’ across breakline and ‘1104’ on other side. They are supplied as follows:
                  Overbagged with 10 extended-release tablets per bag, NDC 55154-7291-0
                  Isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets, USP 60 mg are white to off-white, oval shaped, film coated tablets having breakline on one side and ‘60-60’ debossing across breakline and ‘1105’ on the other side.
                  Overbagged with 10 extended-release tablets per bag, NDC 55154-7292-0
                  Store at 20°-25°C (68°-77°F), excursions permitted to 15°-30°C (59°-86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]

adverseReactions_original: Isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets are contraindicated in patients who have shown hypersensitivity or idiosyncratic reactions to other nitrates or nitrites.
